item.title: Super Mario And Zelda Games Are 50% Off In Amazon's Black Friday Sale
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nintendo's official Black Friday 2025 promotion on exclusive games has arrived with steep discounts on some of the best Switch games at Amazon, Best Buy, and Target. The sale features Mario games from a variety of genres, the latest mainline Zelda game, charming Kirby and Donkey Kong side-scrollers, and more. In the RPG and 3D platforming corners of the Super Mario franchise, two of the best Nintendo games ever made are on sale for 50% off: Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door and Super Mario Odyssey. You can also save 50% on a few rarely discounted games, including The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom and Princess Peach: Showtime.

In addition to the game deals, you can snag the Amiibo figures that launched alongside the Nintendo Switch 2 for cheap at Best Buy. The Legend of Zelda Amiibo are only $10 each, and Street Fighter 6 Amiibo are $15 each.

Nintendo Switch Exclusives: Black Friday Game Deals

Only three of the nine games featured in the sale were supposed to be 50% off, but Target cut an extra $10 from Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, Princess Peach: Showtime, and Donkey Kong Country Returns HD. Amazon quickly matched these $30 deals, so the actual number of half-off deals is six. If physical editions of the games listed below sell out, digital versions are eligible at multiple retailers, including Amazon and Best Buy. That said, the digital codes align with Nintendo's official price points, so Echoes of Wisdom is $40 instead of $30.

  • The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom
    • Amazon -- $30 ($60)
    • Target -- $30 ($60)
    • Best Buy -- $40 ($60)
    • Walmart
  • Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door
    • Best Buy -- $30 ($60)
    • Amazon -- $30 ($60)
    • Target -- $30 ($60)
    • Walmart
  • Princess Peach: Showtime
    • Amazon -- $30 ($60)
    • Target -- $30 ($60)
    • Best Buy -- $40 ($60)
    • Walmart
  • Super Mario Odyssey
    • Best Buy -- $30 ($60)
    • Amazon -- $30 ($60)
    • Target -- $30 ($60)
    • Walmart
  • Donkey Kong Country Returns
    • Amazon -- $30 ($60)
    • Target -- $30 ($60)
    • Best Buy -- $40 ($60)
    • Walmart
  • Splatoon 3
    • Best Buy -- $30 ($60)
    • Amazon -- $30 ($60)
    • Target -- $30 ($60)
    • Walmart
  • Nintendo Switch Sports
    • Best Buy -- $30 ($50)
    • Amazon -- $30 ($50)
    • Target -- $30 ($50)
    • Walmart
  • Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe
    • Best Buy -- $40 ($60)
    • Amazon -- $40 ($60)
    • Target -- $40 ($60)
    • Walmart
  • Luigi's Mansion 3
    • Best Buy -- $40 ($60)
    • Amazon -- $40 ($60)
    • Target -- $40 ($60)
    • Walmart

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, the first Nintendo-developed entry in the series featuring Princess Zelda in the leading role, is a wonderful top-down adventure for fans of all ages. It merges the classic formula with the playfulness found in Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom. Speaking of Nintendo's most recognizable female characters, Princess Peach: Showtime is the Super Mario heroine's first starring role since Super Princess Peach in 2005. It mixes several genres, including platforming, action, and fighting.

Nintendo isn't offering discounts on Switch 2 games, but all nine games can be played on the new console and three of them have free Switch 2 updates that improve performance and add new features: Super Mario Odyssey, Splatoon 3, and Echoes of Wisdom. Mario Odyssey and Echoes of Wisdom both support HDR and genuinely look like remasters on Switch 2.

If you're looking for classic side-scrolling platformers with local co-op modes that are great for parents and kids, Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe and Donkey Kong Country Returns HD are definitely worth checking out at these prices. Both games are great remasters of Nintendo Wii hits. Kirby is a friendlier platformer for newcomers, but the Switch version of DKC Returns HD retains the more forgiving Modern Mode from the Nintendo 3DS port. Another great pick for your next family game night is Nintendo Switch Sports, the spiritual successor to Wii Sports. Luigi's Mansion 3 also has a few fun local multiplayer minigames to complement a terrific story mode starring the Mushroom Kingdom's best Ghostbuster.

Nintendo Switch 2 Amiibo: Black Friday Deals

  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Amiibo
    • Tulin -- $10 ($30)
    • Riju -- $10 ($30)
    • Yunobo -- $10 ($30)
    • Sidon -- $10 ($30)
  • Street Fighter 6 Amiibo
    • Luke -- $15 ($40)
    • Jamie -- $15 ($40)
    • Kimberly -- $15 ($40)
  • See all Amiibo deals at Best Buy
  • See all Amiibo deals at Amazon

The four latest Zelda Amiibo carried $30 price tags at launch. They have been discounted a few times since June, but never to as low as they are now. The same can be said about the Street Fighter 6 Amiibo, which were priced even higher at launch. Best Buy has slashed $25 from all three characters, so you can get the three fighters for $45 total--five bucks more than Street Fighter fans paid for one figure at launch. Amazon is matching Best Buy's prices on two Zelda Amiibo--and probably all four soon.

Zelda Amiibo Deals at Amazon:

  • Sidon -- $10 ($30)
  • Riju -- $10 ($30)
  • Tulin -- $15 ($30)
  • Yunobo -- $15 ($30)

For more Nintendo Switch game deals, check out our massive roundup with 150+ deals on third-party Switch 2 and Switch games.

item.title: PlayStation Portal Remote Gaming Handheld Gets Nice Black Friday Price Cut
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Sony has a month-long promotion running on its PlayStation games and hardware, just in time for Black Friday and the holiday season. One of the devices on sale is its handheld game-streaming unit, the PlayStation Portal, which is going for $179 (was $200). Available in two colors--Midnight Black and White--the handheld merges a sharp display with a DualSense Controller to let you stream games over Wi-Fi. While you originally needed a PS5 console to use it, a recent update unlocked full cloud-streaming capabilities for the PS Portal.

PlayStation Portal (Midnight Black)

$179 (was $200)

The PS Portal has an 8-inch LCD screen, and the attached controller grips offer the same haptic feedback and adaptive triggers found on the DualSense controller. Sony has also updated the device to make switching between cloud streaming and remote play from your PS5 easier. As long as you have a strong Wi-Fi connection, you'll be able to play any of the games in your PlayStation library. Cloud streaming does require a PS Plus Premium membership, and nearly 3,000 games support the feature.

PlayStation Link technology, developed for the PS Portal, allows for low latency and lossless audio. PlayStation's Pulse Explore Earbuds and Pulse Elite Headset have PlayStation Link and are an ideal audio option for anyone who picks up the PlayStation Portal deal. Pulse Explore Wireless Earbuds are discounted to $169 (was $200), while the Pulse Elite Headset is down to $129 (was $150).

PlayStation accessories on sale for Black Friday

The PS Portal can also connect seamlessly to several PlayStation accessories, including the aforementioned Pulse Explore Earbuds and Pulse Elite Headset. Both are wireless audio options for PlayStation hardware, and both are on sale. Available in White and Midnight Black, the Pulse Explore earbuds are $169 (was $200) and come with six earbud tips for a better fit. They support PS5 audio features like Tempest 3D Audio, include two hidden microphones for chat, and can run for up to five hours on a full charge.

The Pulse Elite headset is discounted to $129 (was $149) and offers strong battery life and high-quality audio. The over-ear headset supports spatial audio, features a retractable mic, and uses premium materials for the earcups. It comes with several accessories, including the PlayStation Link adapter, USB-C cable, charging hanger, and mounting plate.

Pulse Explore Wireless Earbuds (Midnight Black) -- $169 ($199)

  • Amazon
  • PS Direct
  • Walmart
  • Target
  • Best Buy

Pulse Explore Wireless Earbuds (White) -- $169 ($199)

  • Amazon
  • PS Direct
  • Walmart
  • Best Buy

Pulse Elite Wireless Headset (Midnight Black) -- $130 ($149)

  • Amazon
  • PS Direct
  • Walmart
  • Target
  • Best Buy

Pulse Elite Wireless Headset (White) -- $130 ($149)

  • Amazon
  • PS Direct
  • Walmart
  • Target
  • Best Buy

If you don't have a PS Plus Premium subscription, the PS Portal will only be able to stream games via Remote Play from your PS5 console. Sony has discounted all of its PS5 console models, and you can get one for as little as $450 for when you want to switch to a big screen for your gaming.

Almost every PS5 exclusive game is also on sale currently, including recent releases like Death Stranding 2: On the Beach and Lost Soul Aside. Sony has also given several of its older exclusives substantial discounts, with prices ranging from $20 - $30 for games like God of War Ragnarok, Marvel's Spider-Man 2, and The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered.

PS5 owners can save $20 on all DualSense controllers during Sony's holiday sale. This special extends to the limited-edition Astro Bot Joyful, God of War 20th Anniversary, and Ghost of Yotei with gold or black accents controllers, and the sale runs through December 18. Like last year, the chances that several of these controllers will sell out before the promotion ends remain high, so you'll want to click the link below to see if anything catches your eye.

And if you want your console controller to have more customization options, check out the DualSense Edge, which is on sale for $169 (was $200).
